meanings.definition: The act of making someone or something miserable or impoverished.
meanings.sent1: The immiseration of the villagers by the greedy landlord led to widespread poverty.
meanings.sent2: The immiseration of the workers was evident in their low wages and poor living conditions.
meanings.sent3: The immiseration of the birthday party clown was caused by a shortage of balloons and cake.
meanings.sent4: The immiseration of the environment due to pollution is a pressing concern for future generations.
meanings.sent5: The immiseration of the characters in the novel painted a bleak picture of society.

meanings.definition: The state of being made miserable or impoverished.
meanings.sent1: The immiseration of the refugees was heartbreaking to witness.
meanings.sent2: The immiseration of the family was evident in their tattered clothes and empty pantry.
meanings.sent3: The immiseration of the pet goldfish was due to overfeeding by the forgetful child.
meanings.sent4: The immiseration of the economy left many struggling to make ends meet.
meanings.sent5: The immiseration of the students' spirits was lifted by a surprise visit from their favorite teacher.
